summary: not as dark as my other edits... in some ways ;)
descriptionHtml:
[color=Lightsteelblue][b]Description :[/b][/color] I was aiming for more of a weapon set I would actually use in game than anything else, no idea if this looks more or less glass-like than the vanilla texture. If I knew how to make standalone weapons then I would probably call this the emerald set instead of glass :)

[color=Lightsteelblue][b]Double Size Versions :[/b][/color] This is NOT a HD retexture. I have done the odd edit on this set of textures that may benefit from people using higher res vs lossless though.. personally I will be using double res with normal vanilla compression I think

[color=Lightsteelblue][b]Lossless Versions :[/b][/color] These 24/32bit versions give a nicer depth to the textures and should be free from any artifacts, but are much more memory intensive so if you are already low on V-RAM then avoid :). If anyone feels like editing my textures to their tastes (or mixing in the vanilla texture if you think I have gone OTT hehe) then these are also a lot nicer starting point.

[color=Lightsteelblue][b]Double Size Lossless Versions :[/b][/color] For using as a custom edit base only :) ; I usually have around 700 meg v-ram free when out in the wilds of skyrim but when I tried to drop all of these weapons onto the ground it caused a CTD twice.. and that was before I made all of the environment masks 1k instead of 256 or whatever crazy they were :P

[color=Lightsteelblue][b]Possible Conflict Issues :[/b][/color] I don't really have much of an issue with vanilla skyrim's crazy specular maps in this particular case so since I didnt edit them I left out the normal (which is also spec) files.. if you have another texture mod that covers glass weapons then you might get nasty results installing this over it without removing the other mod so skyrim can default back to the hd texture pack 1 normal map files.

[color=Lightsteelblue][b]Installation :[/b][/color] Pick a version you like the look of and go for it, since it's only a texture replacing mod you can just extract to your data folder / install using a mod manager as normal.

[color=Lightsteelblue][b]Screenshots :[/b][/color] I always use the lossless versions of my textures alongside an edited [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/30936/?/]RealVision Nova ENB[/url] with [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/27043/?/]Enhanced Lights And FX[/url]


[center][color=Lightsteelblue][b](: More Spooky Edits :)[/b][/color]

[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/56654/?]Darker Thieves Guild Armor[/url][/center][center][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/56610/?]Darker Jester Clothes[/url]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/56587/?]Darker Mehrunes Razor[/url]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/55725/?]Darker Dark Brotherhood Shrouded Armor and Robes[/url]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/55809/]Reworked Vanilla Female Shrouded Armor Texture Fix[/url]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/54816/?]Darker Vampire Armor[/url]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/54641/?]Darker Falmer Heavy Armor and Weapons[/url]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/54463/]Darker Female Archmage Robes[/url][/center]
author: SpookyMunky

files.name: Spooky Edits - Glass Weapons - Double Res
files.fileName: Spooky Edits - Darker Glass Weapons - Double Res-54998-0-2.7z
files.changelogHtml:
Initial release notes...

This set turned out to be a bit of a pain compared to my other edits since I had to diverge from my very little texture painting mindset to try and achieve a look I kind of like. I'm still not happy with the overall look but with 10 weapons and 9 env maps to go with each, all needing individual attention.. it has become a serious downer ! :). I also felt the need to draw a line in the sand hehe, stop my continuous edits with an official release :P

My apologies that not all weapons match each others look, I'm just a bit sick of these just now and figured I would get an idea of what people want and maybe move onto something else, with the intention of coming back once I have gotten the feel for it in game (same with all of my mods).

Also a couple of weapons like the greatsword and swords have a split uv which made me shy away a bit from some of the overlays etc I used on the other weapons since I didn't want to leave a nasty seam in the middle of a weapon.. I have probably introduced seams on other weapons but I haven't been able to notice them yet, sorry in advance if you see something ugly.

On the brighter side, I have learned quite a few lessons from this, which is my main goal with these edits :)
